alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Mercer (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 11:36AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Louisa, Mercer, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Rock Island and Scott Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Louisa, Mercer, Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jo Daviess, Carroll, Clinton and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Rock Island, Whiteside and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Lee, Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Carroll, Whiteside and Clinton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keithsburg. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects a campground along the river at Keithsburg. At 14.5 feet, Water affects low lying areas in Oquawka. At 17.5 feet, Water affects most houses on 1st Street in Oquawka. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Friday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 17.5 feet Friday morning. Additional rises are expected thereafter. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued this evening.
